articles.title: West Sea Fleet of KPA Navy Warns Enemies against Military Moves in Hotspot Waters in West Sea
articles.content:
West Sea Fleet of KPA Navy Warns Enemies against Military Moves in Hotspot Waters in West Sea
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The West Sea Fleet of the Navy of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Monday released the following report:
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet military warmongers are these days massively increasing armed forces in the vicinity of the five islands in the West Sea and making adventurous military provocations against the maritime guard line of the KPA.
					
					 The south Korean military decided to permanently deploy two commando teams of the puppet army on the Yonphyong Island and is massively increasing naval forces including warships.
					
					 Recently the south Korean military hurled spying means including drones into the air above the vicinity of five islands of the West Sea of Korea to spy the area of the KPA.
					
					 The south Korean Navy let speedboats and guard ships intrude into the waters of the north side under the pretext of controlling Chinese ships' illegal fishing.
					
					 Timed to coincide with this, brass hats of the south Korean army went to the forefront area of the West Sea to examine the readiness for coping with the possible "provocation" by the north.
					
					 The south Korean military warmongers went the lengths of staging the farce of "creating fish-breeding reef".
					
					 The "fish-breeding reef", structure weighing dozens of tones, is being set up in the sensitive waters which witnessed three skirmishes in the past, a fact clearly showing the provocative nature.
					
					 Such military provocations escalating in the world's biggest hotspot waters are a revelation of the sinister intention to spark off a military conflict in the said waters and defend the illegal and brigandish "northern limit line" at any cost.
					
					 The gravity of the developments has been augmented as the reckless moves of the puppet military warmongers are being perpetrated at the U.S. active instigation.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces appeared at the Military Demarcation Line in Panmunjom at around 2:45 on Sunday to inform the "creation of fish breeding reef" over loudspeaker.
					
					 The U.S. went so ridiculous as to use the phrase "south of the northern limit line" when describing the site of creation, revealing its foolish attempt to give impression that the illegal and ghost line is the extension of the military demarcation line in waters of the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 The KPA is clearly seeing through the enemies' scheme for military provocation.
					
					 It is the black-hearted intention of the aggressors and provokers to perpetrate a military provocation in the sensitive waters in a bid to induce the KPA into self-defensive counteraction and describe it as "provocation" and "threat."
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces had better behave themselves if they do not want to meet a dog's death in the waters.
					
					 The KPA will mercilessly frustrate the dangerous military moves escalated by the enemies in the hotspot waters in the West Sea.

articles.title: U.S. Will Meet Doom If It Ignites Second Korean War: Spokesman for Foreign Ministry of DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Will Meet Doom If It Ignites Second Korean War: Spokesman for Foreign Ministry of DPRK
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK released the following statement on Monday:
					 The DPRK, who won a victory in the confrontation of rifles and A bombs in the war ignited by the U.S. in the1950s thanks to the Juche-based war methods and leadership of President Kim Il Sung, has registered a series of victories in an all-out stand-off with the U.S., demonstrating its might as an invincible nuclear power, a power with elite army, under the Songun guidance of leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Much water has flown under the bridge since the hard-fought war in the 1950s but the U.S. remains unchanged in its wild ambition to invade the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has persisted in its arms buildup, war drills and military provocations on the Korean peninsula, seized with its invariable scenario to stifle the DPRK and dominate Asia and the world, far from drawing a lesson from the serious political and military defeats it sustained in the past Korean war.
					
					 It dared hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, not content with escalating harsh sanctions and pressure upon it while massively introducing various strategic nuclear strike means and latest war hardware into south Korea. While stepping up the moves to deploy THAAD, the U.S. is busy staging ever more undisguised war drills.
					
					 Despite the international community's concern and denunciation of the its saber-rattling pushing the situation on the Korean peninsula to the brink of a war, the U.S. is mulling staging Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drills targeting the DPRK in August in league with the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 If the U.S. opts for igniting the second Korean war in defiance of the strategic position of the DPRK and the trend of the times, it will never escape its final doom with no one left to sign a surrender document.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Koryo Songgyungwan University
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Koryo Songgyungwan University
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of Koryo Songgyungwan University to learn about its educational conditions and environment.
					 This university trains technical personnel in the field of light industry.
					
					 The premier was briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung visited the university in the last period of his life, unrolling a blueprint for the university development. The premier acquainted himself with the construction, education system and environment of the university, etc. 
					
					 The premier held a consultative meeting of officials concerned on the spot.
					
					 He emphasized that consolidating the material and technical foundation of the university is a responsible work to carry out the behests of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He discussed the measures for improving the educational conditions and environment by building a new modern gymnasium, library and practice factory and for stepping up technical preparations for each building object as immediate tasks.
					
					 In the meantime, he acquainted himself with farming in Kaesong City and Jangphung County and took relevant measures.
					
					 He looked round the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and called for boosting the iron and steel production in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Visit East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Visit East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Li Jinjun, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials visited East Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1 on Monday.
					 Being briefed on the fact that the students are preparing to be persons well versed in science and technology, the guests looked round a room dedicated to the history of the school, Mao Zedong class, etc.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by students.

articles.title: Members of Egyptian Embassy Visit Kim Song Ju Primary School
articles.content:
Members of Egyptian Embassy Visit Kim Song Ju Primary School
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Iman Mostafa Abdou Ahmed, Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Egyptian embassy toured Kim Song Ju Primary School, the DPRK-Egypt friendship school, Monday on the 64th anniversary of the July 23 revolution in Egypt.
					 The guests laid a bouquet before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the school and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They went round various educational facilities at the school which tell about the leadership of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and enjoyed an art performance given by schoolchildren.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Meet
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Meet
Hamhung, July 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting of foreign crewmen was held at Hungnam Port Monday to mark the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 They laid a bunch of flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Hamhung City and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Present at the meeting were the captain and crewmen of the Sierra Leone-flagged ship GLORYHOPE 6.
					
					 The speakers praised the President as the legendary hero who defeated the U.S. imperialists and their followers by leading the bloody three-year war in the 1950s to victory.
					
					 The wise and brave Korean people who lived as a homogeneous nation with pride in the time-honored history and brilliant culture of fifty centuries brought about July 27 victory by beating back the invasion by the U.S. imperialists under the wise leadership of the President.
					
					 The historic victory in the war is the shining victory of the original strategy and tactics and the Juche-oriented war methods of the President, and a great demonstration of invincible power of the heroic Korean people who got united around the party and the leader in one mind, they noted.
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people will achieve big successes in their work to attain the grand goals put forward by the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea and achieve the independent reunification of the country and build a powerful socialist country, united close around Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Meetings with DPRK Hero Held
articles.content:
Meetings with DPRK Hero Held
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Youth and students in Pyongyang and agricultural workers held meetings with DPRK heroes Monday on the 63rd anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present at the meetings were Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK), officials concerned, officials of the youth league and the UAWK, youths and students, agricultural workers and members of the UAWK.
					
					 DPRK Hero Ji Yong Chun, lecturer of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, made a speech at the meeting of the youths and students of Pyongyang held at the Central Youth Hall.
					
					 He said he, working as democratic youth league chairman of his company during the past war, fought at the cost of his life for President Kim Il Sung, who liberated the country and provided him with a genuine life, and killed, injured and captured hundreds of enemies in various battles including those on Mungyong Pass and Mt. Samyong.
					
					 He called upon all the youth and students to carry forward the fighting spirit of the preceding generation, who won a war victory, in order to defend Marshal Kim Jong Un unto death and always win victory in the confrontation with the imperialists and U.S. under the guidance of the Party.
					
					 DPRK Hero Pak In Ho, lecturer of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, at the meeting at the Janggyo Co-op Farm in Kangnam County told about how the People's Army contained the U.S. imperialist armed spy ship Pueblo in just 14 minutes and captured the aggressors.
					
					 He called on the officials of the UAWK and agricultural workers to give steady continuity to the history and tradition of a great victory of war and register a signal success in this year's grain production.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meetings.

articles.title: Art Performances of KPA Officers' Wives Given before Full House
articles.content:
Art Performances of KPA Officers' Wives Given before Full House
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Performances of amateur art groups of officers' wives of units of the Korean People's Army (KPA) selected in the sixth round of the second-term art performance contest of KPA officers' wives were given before full house here from July 17 to 24.
					 Put on the stage were narration and chorus "Glory to General Kim Jong Un", instrumental quartet "Always Thinking of General", chorus "We'll Travel One Road Forever" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the servicemen's families taking the lead in building a powerful socialist country.
					
					 The performances deeply impressed the audience.
					
					 Among the audience were officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, service personnel, officers' wives, creators, artistes, teachers and students in the field of literature and arts and Pyongyangites.

articles.title: Art and Literature Publishing House Observes Its 70th Anniversary
articles.content:
Art and Literature Publishing House Observes Its 70th Anniversary
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Art and Literature Publishing House marked its 70th founding anniversary.
					 The publishing house founded on July 25, Juche 35 (1946) has developed into a powerful art and literature publishing base of the Workers' Party of Korea under the guidance of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu over the past seven decades.
					
					 After the liberation of the country, President Kim Il Sung gave an important instruction that the publishing house should make a positive contribution to creating the national culture by issuing a lot of revolutionary art and literature publications, important ideological and educational means of the party, reading the magazine "Cultural Front", the first publication of the country's art and literature, and guided the work of the publishing house.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il gave instructions on publishing a lot of art and literature works loved by the people while visiting the publishing house several times and clearly indicated the orientation and ways to be taken by it in his works.
					
					 The publishing house has made positive contributions to educating the people about the greatness of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu by editing and publishing a series of full-length novels introducing their revolutionary history and books on their noble virtues and memoirs dealing with their exploits.
					
					 A meeting took place at the People's Palace of Culture Monday to mark the anniversary.

articles.title: Memorial Service for King Tangun Registered as National Intangible Heritage
articles.content:
Memorial Service for King Tangun Registered as National Intangible Heritage
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for King Tangun, ancestral father of the Korean nation, was listed as one of national intangible heritages in the DPRK.
					 Tangun was a founder of Ancient Korea (early 30th century B.C.-108 B.C.), the first slave state in Korea, was known as a powerful country in the East.
					
					 From olden times, memorial service for King Tangun took place at his mausoleum and other sites associated with him on October 3, the Foundation Day of Korea which has been believed to be his birthday.
					
					 A number of historical records related to the mausoleum of King Tangun and memorial service for him can be found in old books like "Samgukyusa (History of the Three Kingdoms)" and "Sinjungdonggukyojisungnam (Revised Handbook of Korean Geography)".
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il took all necessary measures to unearth the remains of Tangun, who was nearly faded away with the lapse of time by vicious moves of the Japanese imperialist aggressors and reactionary historians and incompetence of ruling circles of the Feudal Joson Dynasty, to glorify Korea as the country with a 5 000-year-long history.
					
					 When the remains of King Tangun were unearthed, Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il saw to it that his mausoleum was reconstructed majestically, as befitted the ancestral father.
					
					 Now, an event takes place in front of the Mausoleum of King Tangun in Kangdong County, Pyongyang on October 3 every year in hopes of achieving the national reunification, the ardent desire of the Korean nation, as early as possible.

articles.title: Economic Achievements Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Economic Achievements Made in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Signal achievements have been made in various economic sectors of the DPRK in 50 days after the start of the 200-day campaign, a drive launched to significantly adorn this year that witnessed the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 In the power industry, the electricity output increased much more than scheduled, through a brisk technical innovation movement at thermal power plants and careful management at hydropower stations.
					
					 The country's coal production plan was carried out at 103 percent while the metal industrial establishments hit their production targets.
					
					 The railway transport sector, too, over-fulfilled its freight assignment by 16 percent. 
					
					 Similar successes were also reported from such major industrial sectors as machine, chemistry, building-materials and forestry.
					
					 And a rapid progress was made in the light industry, the food and consumer goods industries and the fisheries to considerably improve the people's livelihood.
					
					 Meanwhile, the construction of Ryomyong Street in Pyongyang is making good headway. Its frame-working reached the final stage and interior and exterior plastering was finished at some apartment houses.

articles.title: Damage Caused by Heavy Rain in DPRK
articles.content:
Damage Caused by Heavy Rain in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- It rained heavily in North Phyongan Province and other parts of the DPRK from July 22 to 24.
					 Especially, the rainfall reached over 200 mm in Uiju, Kusong, Suphung, Chonma, Tongchang, Pakchon of North Phyongan Province and Pukchang and Kaechon of South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Human and material losses by landslide were reported from Tokryong area of Uiju County, North Phyongan Province, where ten were killed, four missed and fifty five injured. And 246 houses were completely or partially destroyed.
					
					 Railway was damaged in eight places, 760 meters in total, and roads in ten places together with two bridges.
					
					 The DPRK government takes due measures to reconstruct the disaster area and stabilize its people's livelihood.

articles.title: Sinchon Museum Visited by 722,000 People over One Year
articles.content:
Sinchon Museum Visited by 722 000 People over One Year
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Over 722 000 service personnel and people from all walks of life and school youth and children of more than 9 580 units, overseas Koreans and foreigners visited the Sinchon Museum for the past one year after its remodeling.
					At least 105,000 people visited it just in July this year.
					
					 The museum was open to public last year on the 62nd anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Exhibits and visual aids laying bare the cruelty and brutality of the man-killers are on display there.
					
					The U.S. imperialist aggressors made their way to Sinchon in the period of the temporary strategic retreat of the Korean People's Army during the Fatherland Liberation War and massacred over 35,000 patriotic and innocent people, one fourth of the then population of the county in less than two months.
					
					 The visit helped the visitors harden their pledge to annihilate the aggressors to the last man with a merciless barrage of fire and to give vent to the pent-up grudge of the Korean people without missing a golden chance if the U.S. imperialists start another war on this land.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued new stamps (one sheet and 8 individual stamps) reflecting the tasks set forth at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The emblem of the WPK and letters "Seventh Congress of WPK" are seen in the upper part of the stamp depicting the panoramic view of the April 25 House of Culture where the congress took place.
					
					 Individual stamps carry the instructions given by Marshal Kim Jong Un and letters "Seventh Congress of WPK" against the background of the red flag on which the emblem of the WPK is depicted and the dates of the congress are given. They deal with the tasks facing different fields set forth in Kim Jong Un's Report to the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee.

articles.title: Chongryon Joint Meeting Held to Make Concentrate All Efforts on 100-Day Campaign
articles.content:
Chongryon Joint Meeting Held to Make Concentrate All Efforts on 100-Day Campaign
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A joint meeting of chairmen of the Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), chairpersons of its branches and chiefs of major organizations and officials of education took place in Tokyo.
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, chairpersons and officials of the Headquarters of Chongryon, chairpersons of its branches, leading officials of organizations, teachers of Korean University and Korean high schools and officials of Choson Sinbo Company.
					
					 Ho Jong Man in a report said that Chongryon held a meeting of chairmen of the Headquarters of Chongryon, a meeting of chairpersons of its branches and a joint meeting to preserve and develop the national education one after another from the outset of this year, true to the plan of Marshal Kim Jong Un and conducted this year's work in a militant manner. And an enlarged meeting of the Third Meeting of the 23rd Central Committee of Chongryon was held with splendor on June 27, he noted.
					
					 The purpose of the current  joint meeting is to encourage all organizations to concentrate all efforts on the 100-day campaign in order to put spurs to the emulation among branches to comprehensively carry out the important tasks Kim Jong Un set forth in the letter on May 25, 2015 keeping pace with the people in the homeland all out in the drive to carry out the decision of the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea and the campaign for setting a patriotic example in new heyday and to bring about innovations in national education this year marking the 70th anniversary of enforcement of the secondary education. 
					
					 The reporter called for focusing all efforts on the 100-day campaign to greet the meeting of representatives of chapters of Chongryon-2016 (second meeting of new heyday) to be held in November this year based on the achievements made in the 60-day campaign  staged by the headquarters and branches from the latter part of May.
					
					 Speeches were made at the joint meeting.
					
					 Then followed a consultative meeting of chairmen of the Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon to promote the 100-day campaign.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's Intention of Supporting THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Japan's Intention of Supporting THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The chief Cabinet secretary of Japan recently said other countries have no right to criticize the decision of the U.S. and south Korea on THAAD deployment, uttering that the Japanese government supports it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said remarks made at a time when media are having a field-day over the decision on THAAD deployment in south Korea and confrontation between regional countries is festering cannot be interpreted otherwise than a revelation of the sinister intention of Japan to draw water to its mill by adding fuel to the flames.
					
					 The THAAD deployment in south Korea is not a matter limited to the relations between the U.S. and south Korea but the matter related to peace and security in Northeast Asia, to say nothing of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The decision on THAAD deployment in south Korea is a product of the U.S. sinister scenario to get military supremacy in the Asia-Pacific region and the vicious moves of the south Korean puppet forces for invading the north, backed by their U.S. master.
					
					 Japan is now openly escalating military espionage against the DPRK after concluding an agreement on sharing information with the U.S. and south Korea. Lurking behind Japan's unequivocal support for THAAD deployment in south Korea is a cynical ploy to take the daily worsening situation as a good opportunity of justifying its moves for turning itself into a military giant and finally launching its reinvasion.
					
					 Reinvasion is bound to lead Japan to its second defeat and self-destruction, the commentary warns, urging it to stop recklessly wagging its tongues and mocking the world people and bear in mind that its inveterate bad habit would bring irretrievable disaster to it.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Hysteric Saber-rattling of U.S., S. Korean Regime against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Hysteric Saber-rattling of U.S., S. Korean Regime against DPRK
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet warlike forces recently went mad with drills for blockading the DPRK and striking it from sea together with U.S. and Japanese forces under the pretext of "coping with threat of sub-launched ballistic missiles from the north" as part of the U.S.-led RIMPAC joint military exercises staged in the waters off Hawaii.
					 South Korean puppet forces also staged a drill to rescue pilots from distress together with aircraft of the U.S. Air Force from July 11 to 15.
					
					 Meanwhile, they allowed the U.S. Navy's super-large nuclear submarine Ohio to enter into Pusan Port.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday says that these war rehearsals were prompted by their dangerous scenario for unleashing a war to stifle the DPRK by force of arms, dead-set against detente and peace.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime remain unchanged in their black-hearted scenario to put military pressure on the DPRK through their ceaseless war maneuvers under the pretext of "provocation" and "threat" from it and start a war against it by stepping up the preparations for a preemptive nuclear strike at it.
					
					 The above-said drills were prompted by this scenario.
					
					 The DPRK is the primary target of the RIMPAC.
					
					 A litany of rhetoric reeled off by the south Korean puppet regime about "threat of sub-launched ballistic missiles from the north" would not help cover up the aggressive nature of RIMPAC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Stronger DPRK-Syria Friendship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Stronger DPRK-Syria Friendship
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates an article to the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Syria.
					 The official establishment of the diplomatic relations marked an epochal event and landmark in boosting the bilateral cooperative relations and the friendly ties between the peoples of the two countries, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK and Syria have waged a common struggle in the same trench of the anti-imperialist struggle to protect the sovereignty of the countries and global peace and security.
					
					 This is a clear proof that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation forged and cultivated by the great leaders with much care remain very strong.
					
					 Though the old generation and century are replaced by the new ones, the DPRK-Syria friendship is steadily growing stronger true to the behests of the great preceding leaders.
					
					 The Syrian people are expressing positive support and solidarity for the service personnel and people of the DPRK in the struggle to bring earlier the final victory of the cause of the Juche revolution by upholding the Party's Songun politics and line of simultaneously developing the two fronts in defiance of the U.S. imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK send invariable support and firm solidarity to the Syrian government and people in their just struggle to beat back the invasion and terrorism by the hostile forces at home and abroad and ensure the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country.
					
					 The DPRK government and people will as ever stand by the Syrian government and people in their joint struggle for independence against imperialism.

articles.title: THAAD Deployment Protested across South Korea
articles.content:
THAAD Deployment Protested across South Korea
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Actions are going on in Seoul and other parts of south Korea in protest against the puppet authorities' moves to deploy THAAD, according to south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People.
					Over 1,000 Seoul citizens held a candlelight rally on July 23.
					
					 The speakers underscored the need for the inhabitants of Songju County and all other people to pool their efforts and fight against the outsiders keen to sow the seeds of discord among them in order to get the decision on the deployment repealed.
					
					 A meeting was held by students in Chonggyechon area.
					
					 The speakers said that if THAAD is deployed, it would escalate military tension and turn south Korea into a war base, far from protecting security.
					
					 The Citizen's Action against THAAD Deployment also held a press conference in Youido at which it said that it staged an action in protest against the "government's" and the ruling party's moves to conceal the truth.
					
					 Buddhist organizations held a press conference before the puppet Ministry of Defense on July 21 to disclose the dangerous nature of the THAAD deployment.
					
					 Similar meetings took place in Taejon and Taegu.
					
					 It was reported that candlelight rallies are taking place in Songju, North Kyongsang Province.

articles.title: S. Korean Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Demand Settlement of Past
articles.content:
S. Korean Victims of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Demand Settlement of Past
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- South Korean victims of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army on July 21 held a news conference at the "National Assembly" in demand of the settlement of the past crimes.
					 Speakers there said that the "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army adopted at the end of last year was the one concluded without any discussion with the victims.
					
					 The "agreement" is null and unpardonable from the viewpoint of human rights, they said.
					
					 A statement was read out at the news conference, which urged the "National Assembly" to push forward establishing a special law for the recovery of rights of the victims of the sexual slavery and the forced drafting by the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 The statement stressed the need for the Japanese authorities to make an official apology and legal reparation for the sexual slavery and the UN and the international community to make positive efforts for the settlement of the sexual slavery issue.
					
					 At the end of the news conference the victims of the sexual slavery presented a document demanding the institution of a special law to the "National Assembly".
					
					 Then a workshop took place in which the victims denounced the Japanese authorities for seeking the revival of militarism through amendment of the constitution.
					
					 Noting that the Japanese authorities distort history and beautify the past crimes, they urged the south Korean authorities to carry the facts about the past crimes of aggression by the Japanese imperialists in history textbooks and promote the enactment of the special law without fail.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Denying Working-Level Contact with North
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Denying Working-Level Contact with North
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Media Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration denounced the puppet Defense Ministry for blocking the inter-Korean working-level contact, according to south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News on July 22.
					 The organization accused the ministry of totally denying the request for working-level contact with the north on July 20 under the pretext of the present south-north relations.
					
					 It said it is necessary to protest against THAAD deployment, successfully hold the joint conference and have dialogue between the south and the north in order to achieve peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia.
					
					 It called on media persons in the south and the north to have contact and exchange without fail.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia Marked
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A meeting and film show took place in Ulan Bator, Mongolia on July 19 on the 60th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia.
					 Displayed at the venue of the event were works of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and publications introducing Juche Korea.
					
					 Korean film showing daily-changing Pyongyang was shown.
					
					 Present at the event were figures of the Mongolian preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, Foreign Ministry, Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, Mongolian Kimjongilia Association and the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche and the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and officials of his embassy.
					
					 The chairman of the Mongolian preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu said:
					
					 Sixty years ago, Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people and friend of the Mongolian people, visited Mongolia.
					
					 His visit was a historic event of weighty significance in developing the relations of the two countries.
					
					 2017 is a significant year marking the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 75th birth anniversary of HE Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will positively organize various political and cultural events to praise the exploits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 We wish the Korean people single-mindedly united around HE Kim Jong Un bigger success in their struggle for implementing the decision made at the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by Polish Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by Polish Organization
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Strengthening the People's Army and Creating a Social Climate in Which Prominence Is Given to Military Affairs" was posted by the Polish Branch of the Korean Friendship Association on its website on July 21.
					 The work published on Feb. 4, Juche 81 (1992) deals with the issue of holding a large-scale military parade to celebrate the 60th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army in the presence of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for strengthening the People's Army and creating a climate in which prominence is given to military affairs.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Accuse U.S., Japan, S. Korea of Escalating Danger of Nuclear War
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Accuse U.S., Japan, S. Korea of Escalating Danger of Nuclear War
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on July 19 in denunciation of the U.S. and its stooges Japan and south Korean puppet forces' moves for further escalating the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. held the so-called 4th tripartite vice-foreign ministers meeting in Hawaii on July 14.
					
					 At the meeting it reeled off the stereo-typed rhetoric about "threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 It is mulling shaping the triangular military alliance with Japan and south Korea after laying a foundation for establishing the missile defence system through a decision to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea is aimed at realizing the U.S. purpose for aggression.
					
					 Stop deployment of THAAD in south Korea!
					
					 We oppose the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance for aggression!

articles.title: Russian Newspaper Hails KPA Sailors' Sinking of U.S. Heavy Cruiser during Korean War
articles.content:
Russian Newspaper Hails KPA Sailors' Sinking of U.S. Heavy Cruiser during Korean War
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspaper Vladivostok carried an article titled "The U.S. heavy cruiser Baltimore sank in the Korean sea sixty six years ago" on July 20 on the 63rd anniversary of the Korean people's great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The newspaper said:
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War waged by the Korean people, there was a battle that would shine long in the world history of naval battles in waters off Jumunjin In July 1950.
					
					 The torpedo-boat flotilla of the Korean People's Army won victory in the combat against the U.S. group of big battleships.
					
					The seamen of the KPA sank 17,000 ton-class Baltimore with four torpedo-boats and destroyed 12,000 ton-class light cruiser.
					
					 This is an event to be specially recorded in the world history of naval battles.

articles.title: U.S. Should Drop Its Policy Hostile to DPRK: African Personage
articles.content:
U.S. Should Drop Its Policy Hostile to DPRK: African Personage
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. should roll back its anachronistic policy hostile to the DPRK unconditionally and refrain at once from escalating tensions on the Korean peninsula.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said this in a statement on July 18.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 Peace has not yet settled on the Korean peninsula due to the U.S. policy hostile to the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. has ceaselessly threatened the security of the DPRK by staging joint military drills every year in league with south Korea.
					
					 Followers of the Juche idea, together with the world peace-loving people, denounce the U.S. hostile policy aimed to suffocate socialist Korea.
					
					 The basic key to settling the issue on the peninsula is for the U.S. to drop its anachronistic policy hostile to the DPRK and conclude a peace treaty with it.
					
					 To this end, the U.S. should withdraw its nuclear weapons from south Korea, first of all.
					
					 It should also give up its risky and extremely hegemonic policy threatening peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Asia, being manifested in the nonstop introduction of nuclear strategic assets into south Korea and deployment of THAAD there.

articles.title: British Body Condemns U.S.-S. Korea SOFA
articles.content:
British Body Condemns U.S.-S. Korea SOFA
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted an article condemning the humiliating SOFA between the U.S. and south Korea on its website on July 15.
					 Terming the U.S.-south Korea SOFA reached on July 9, 1966 a treacherous agreement legalizing the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces' presence in south Korea and granting them unlimited privileges, the article noted that SOFA is a noose subjugating everything in south Korea to meeting the U.S. interests for aggression.
					
					 For the past five decades the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces by invoking SOFA have styled themselves de factor rulers and occupants with extraterritorial rights, inflicting all misfortune and pain upon the south Korea people, the article noted, adding:
					
					 SOFA is, indeed, an unheard-of country-selling document which fully reveals that south Korea is a complete colony of the U.S., and a mediaeval slave agreement which legalized the unlimited arbitrary and high-handed practices, murder and plunder by the Yankee murderers.

articles.title: Important Day of DPRK Marked by Russian Body
articles.content:
Important Day of DPRK Marked by Russian Body
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A special write-up was posted by the Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea of Russia on its website on July 25 on the 4th anniversary of the conferment of the title of the DPRK Marshal on supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 An article titled "We extend glory to Comrade Kim Jong Un" illustrated with his photo noted:
					
					 July 17 is the 4th anniversary of the conferment of the title of the DPRK Marshal on Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Defense capability of the DPRK has been remarkably increased under his wise guidance.
					
					 The DPRK succeeded again in a SLBM test-fire in the wake of its success in H-bomb test.
					
					 The DPRK has registered many successes under his leadership despite harsh sanctions imposed by imperialists.
					
					 Its economy has made an eye-opening development.
					
					 We extend thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for setting a brilliant example of far-sightedness on behalf of the working people in Crimea longing for economy and state cohesion and unity and people's idea dating back to the Soviet Union.
					
					 We wish Marshal Kim Jong Un good health and excellent successes in his work for reunification of Korea and development of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del Presidente argelino
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del Presidente argelino
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 10 el Presidente de la Republica Argelina Democratica y Popular, Abdelaziz Bouteflika.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Tengo el placer de extender cordiales felicitaciones a Vd. en nombre del pueblo y el gobierno de Argelia y en el mio propio por su eleccion como Presidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y le deseo con todo corazon los exitos en el desempeno de su noble mision.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para afirmar que me esforzare con Vd. por consolidar y desarrollar las relaciones de cooperacion entre ambos paises conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de Argelia y Corea.

articles.title: Premier coreano recorre el Instituto Superior Coryo Songgyungwan
articles.content:
Premier coreano recorre el Instituto Superior Coryo Songgyungwan
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju averiguo en el terreno las condiciones y ambiente pedagogicos del Instituto Superior Coryo Songgyungwan, encargado de formar al personal tecnico de la rama de industria ligera. 
					Escuchando explicaciones de que en el ultimo periodo de su vida, el Presidente Kim Il Sung visito el plantel docente y presento el proyecto de su desarrollo, Pak se cercioro del estado de construccion, el sistema educativo, el ambiente pedagogico, etc.
					
					Tuvo lugar en el terreno la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios interesados.
					
					En la ocasion se dio enfasis en que la consolidacion de la base material y tecnica del instituto deviene una labor responsable para materializar los legados del Presidente.
					
					Se discutieron los remedios para mejorar las condiciones y ambiente pedagogicos al construir modernamente en el instituto el gimnasio, biblioteca, fabrica de ensayo y otros establecimientos, y por inmediato, para acelerar los preparativos tecnicos correspondientes a cada objeto de construccion.
					
					Por otra parte, el premier se informo del estado de faenas agricolas de la ciudad de Kaesong y el distrito de Jangphung y tomo las medidas necesarias.
					
					En su visita al Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae, subrayo la necesidad de dar buen impulso a la produccion de materiales de hierro y acero trabajando con el espiritu de autofortalecimiento.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela por que Japon aplaude ubicacion de THAAD
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela por que Japon aplaude ubicacion de THAAD
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- Recientemente, al expresar apoyo de su gobierno al emplazamiento de THAAD en suelo surcoreano, el director del secretariado del gabinete de Japon insistio en que otros paises no tienen derecho a cuestionar la decision correspondiente de Estados Unidos y el Sur de Corea.
					Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico este lunes un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					La decision de desplegar el THAAD en el Sur de Corea calienta el circulo de prensa y exacerba el antagonismo entre los paises regionales. En estas circunstancias, se ha escuchado  las palabras arriba citadas que exponen la siniestra intencion del pais isleno de sacar provechos agravando las discrepancias en el tema de THAAD.
					
					Este asunto no es el exclusivo de EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea sino esta relacionado con el mantenimiento de paz y seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico mas alla de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Es producto directo de la ambicion malsana de EE.UU. de tomar la heguemonia militar en la region de Asia-Pacifico y de la campana de confrontacion fratricida de los titeres surcoreanos que quieren agredir al Norte de Corea en contubernio con su amo gringo.
					
					Japon recrudece de modo abierto el espionaje militar sobre la RPDC tras firmar el acuerdo de compartimiento de informaciones con EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea y ahora apoya activamente el emplazamiento de THAAD en suelo surcoreano con la intencion de aprovechar el empeoramiento de la situacion para justificar la conversion en potencia militar y emprender la nueva agresion.
					
					La reagresion es la via de repeticion de derrota y autodestruccion. Japon no debe burlarse de la humanidad con sus palabras imprudentes, sino darse cuenta de que este vicio puede causarle desastres irremediables.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena belicismo anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y titeres surcoreanos
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena belicismo anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y titeres surcoreanos
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- En el entrenamiento militar conjunto RIMPAC, desarrollado hace poco en las periferias de Hawai bajo el liderazgo de EE.UU., los belicistas titeres surcoreanos ejercitaron con sus amos norteamericano y japones el bloqueo y el ataque desde el mar contra la RPDC, bajo el pretexto de "hacer frente a la amenaza de SLBM del Norte".
					Desde el dia 11 al 15, perpetraron junto con los efectivos de las fuerzas aereas agresoras de EE.UU. el ejercicio de rescate a los pilotos siniestrados. Por otra parte, cometieron otro acto provocador de introducir el submarino nuclear de tamano supergrande de EE.UU., Ohio, en el Puerto de Pusan.
					
					En un comentario individual difundido hoy, el diario Rodong Sinmun condena que tales movimientos militares dejan conocer el peligroso intento de provocar la guerra para aplastar con fuerzas armadas a la RPDC oponiendose obstinadamente al alivio de tension y la paz, y prosigue:
					
					Es invariable la intencion de EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos de ejercer la presion militar a la RPDC con incesantes entrenamientos belicos de diferentes tipos, que toman por pretexto la "provocacion" y "amenaza" de alguien, y ejecutar a toda costa la agresion al Norte al completar los preparativos de ataque preventivo nuclear.
					
					Para ese fin, los titeres surcoreanos desarrollaron esta vez los entrenamientos militares arriba citados en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					La RPDC es el blanco principal de RIMPAC que libran cada ano EE.UU. y las fuerzas seguidoras.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos no pueden ocultar el caracter agresivo de RIMPAC, que persigue el bloqueo maritimo y el ataque preventivo contra la RPDC, con el rumor de la supuesta "amenaza de SLBM del Norte".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun conmemora 50o aniversario de relaciones diplomaticas con Siria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun conmemora 50o aniversario de relaciones diplomaticas con Siria
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ACNC) -- El establecimiento de oficiales relaciones diplomaticas con Siria devino un acontecimiento trascendental para ampliar y desarrollar la cooperacion bilateral y consolidar la amistad entre los dos pueblos.
					Adelanta asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual publicado hoy en ocasion del 50o aniversario de establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas RPDC-Siria, y prosigue:
					
					La RPDC y Siria vinieron luchando intensamente en conjunto en la misma trinchera antiimperialista por preservar la soberania nacional, la paz y la seguridad del mundo. 
					
					Este hecho es un testimonio de que son muy solidas y magnificas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre dos paises, preparadas con muchos esfuerzos por los grandes Lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Aunque se ha cambiado el siglo y se sucedieron las generaciones, la amistad RPDC-Siria sigue desarrollandose segun el legado de los lideres antecesores.
					
					El pueblo sirio manifiesta el apoyo total y solidaridad a los militares y habitantes coreanos que en acato a la politica de Songun y la linea de desarrollo paralelo del partido sobre la construccion de potencia economica y fuerzas armadas nucleares, luchan por adelantar la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche frustrando las tentativas del imperio yanqui de aplastar a la RPDC. 
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo coreanos envian invariable apoyo y firme solidaridad a la justa lucha del gobierno y el pueblo de Siria por defender la soberania y la integridad territorial del pais frustrando la agresion y terrorismo de las fuerzas hostiles internas y externas. 
					
					En el futuro tambien, estaran siempre junto con el gobierno y pueblo sirios en la lucha conjunta por la independencia antiimperialista.
